body.class: html not-front not-logged-in one-sidebar sidebar-first page-node page-node- page-node-471048 node-type-page governor fixed-grid grid-24-based bf-a fs-medium governor-skin governor-skin

p.strong: For the latest COVID-19 health guidance, statistics and resources, visit Coronavirus.wa.gov.

input.title: Enter the terms you wish to search for.
input.name: search_block_form

li.class: tb-megamenu-item level-1 mega megaIssues dropdown active

li.a: COVID-19 resources for businesses and workers

li.class: tb-megamenu-item level-1 mega megaBoards mega-align-justify dropdown

li.a: Apply to Serve on a Board or Commission
Select Committee on Quality Improvement in State Hospitals

li.class: tb-megamenu-item level-1 mega megaContact mega-align-justify dropdown

li.a: Invite Gov. Inslee to an Event
Request a meeting with the Governor
Request a Ceremonial Proclamation, Greeting or Letter
COVID-19 resources for businesses and workers

div.class: article node node-page node-promoted node-sticky node-odd node-full clearfix

img.alt: Gov Inslee and other state and federal leaders address the media about the COVID-19 outbreak at Camp Murray, March 5.

p.strong: For the latest information and resources, see the new state website:

b.a: Get resources for you and your family

p.b: The Employment Security Department expanded benefits for workers impacted by COVID-19. ​See who qualifies for specific benefits.

li.b: Benefits for employees directed to isolate or quarantine

p.b: For quarantined heath care workers and first responders:

a.title: COVID-19 resource list for impacted Washington businesses and workers

b.a: Get resources for impacted businesses and workers

p.b: You can assist our statewide COVID-19 response by donating labor, goods, services, facilities, etc.

b.strong: Governor Inslee ordered non-essential businesses to close until at least April 6 unless all employees can work remotely.

p.b: Need further clarification about your business?

b.a: Fill out the Essential Business Inquiries form

p.b: We have ordered Washington health insurers to waive deductibles and cost-sharing for coronavirus testing. For information related to:
For Washingtonians without health insurance: the Washington Health Benefits Exchange opened a limited-time special enrollment period through April 8, 2020.
For information about state veterans homes:

b.a: Visit the WA Dept. of Veterans Affairs webpage
For information specific to your county, visit the website of your local health department:
All other county health departments and districts

li.a: Job openings in the Governor's Office
